intro: Mitrasacme neldneri, commonly known as the Neldner's mitrasacme, is a flowering plant native to specific regions in South America. It belongs to the family Malvaceae, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its palmate leaves and showy, trumpet-shaped flowers that bloom in shades of pink and white. It thrives in moist, well-drained soils and is often found in tropical or subtropical climates. Due to its unique morphology and limited distribution, it is of interest to botanists and horticulturists alike.
